intro: Veronica kopgecidiensis, commonly known as the Cape Verde veronica, is a flowering plant native to the island of Santiago in the Cape Verde archipelago. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It blooms with blue to purple flowers during the wet season, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited geographic distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
